documents.title: Clipboard API
documents.summary: The Clipboard API provides the ability to respond to clipboard commands (cut, copy, and paste), as well as to asynchronously read from and write to the system clipboard.

body: The specification refers to this as the 'Async <mark>Clipboard</mark> <mark>API</mark>'.
The specification refers to this as the '<mark>Clipboard</mark> Event <mark>API</mark>'.
The <mark>Clipboard</mark> <mark>API</mark> extends the following APIs, adding the listed features.
title: <mark>Clipboard</mark> <mark>API</mark>

documents.title: clipboard
documents.summary: The WebExtension clipboard API (which is different from the standard Clipboard API) enables an extension to copy items to the system clipboard. Currently the WebExtension clipboard API only supports copying images, but it's intended to support copying text and HTML in the future.

body: The WebExtension <mark>clipboard</mark> <mark>API</mark> (which is different from the standard <mark>Clipboard</mark> <mark>API</mark>) enables an extension to copy items to
The WebExtension <mark>clipboard</mark> <mark>API</mark> may be deprecated once the standard <mark>Clipboard</mark> <mark>API</mark>'s support for non-text <mark>clipboard</mark> contents

Note:
This <mark>API</mark> is based on Chromium's chrome.<mark>clipboard</mark> <mark>API</mark>.
title: <mark>clipboard</mark>

documents.title: Clipboard
documents.summary:
The Clipboard interface of the Clipboard API provides read and write access to the contents of the system clipboard.
This allows a web application to implement cut, copy, and paste features.

body: The <mark>Clipboard</mark> interface of the <mark>Clipboard</mark> <mark>API</mark> provides read and write access to the contents of the system <mark>clipboard</mark>.
All of the <mark>Clipboard</mark> <mark>API</mark> methods operate asynchronously; they return a Promise which is resolved once the <mark>clipboard</mark> access
Additional requirements for using the <mark>API</mark> are discussed in the Security consideration section of the <mark>API</mark> overview topic.
title: <mark>Clipboard</mark>

documents.title: ClipboardItem: ClipboardItem() constructor
documents.summary: The ClipboardItem() constructor creates a new ClipboardItem object, which represents data to be stored or retrieved via the Clipboard API clipboard.write() and clipboard.read() methods, respectively.

body: <mark>Clipboard</mark> <mark>API</mark> <mark>clipboard</mark>.write() and <mark>clipboard</mark>.read() methods, respectively.

See the browser compatibility table for the <mark>Clipboard</mark> interface.
jsnew <mark>Clipboard</mark>Item(data)
new <mark>Clipboard</mark>Item(data, options
title: <mark>Clipboard</mark>Item: <mark>Clipboard</mark>Item() constructor

documents.title: ClipboardItem
documents.summary: The ClipboardItem interface of the Clipboard API represents a single item format, used when reading or writing clipboard data using Clipboard.read() and Clipboard.write() respectively.

body: The <mark>Clipboard</mark>Item interface of the <mark>Clipboard</mark> <mark>API</mark> represents a single item format, used when reading or writing <mark>clipboard</mark>
If it is, we fetch an SVG image with the Fetch <mark>API</mark>, and then read it into a Blob, which we can use to create a <mark>Clipboard</mark>Item
title: <mark>Clipboard</mark>Item

documents.title: ClipboardEvent
documents.summary: The ClipboardEvent interface of the Clipboard API represents events providing information related to modification of the clipboard, that is cut, copy, and paste events.

body: The <mark>Clipboard</mark>Event interface of the <mark>Clipboard</mark> <mark>API</mark> represents events providing information related to modification of the

Event

Copy-related events: copy, cut, paste

documents.title: ClipboardEvent: ClipboardEvent() constructor
documents.summary: The ClipboardEvent() constructor returns a new ClipboardEvent, representing an event providing information related to modification of the clipboard, that is cut, copy, and paste events.

body: The <mark>Clipboard</mark>Event() constructor returns a new <mark>Clipboard</mark>Event, representing an event providing information related to modification

of the <mark>clipboard</mark>, that is cut, copy, and paste events.

documents.title: Interact with the clipboard
documents.summary: Working with the clipboard in extensions is transitioning from the Web API document.execCommand method (which is deprecated) to the navigator.clipboard method.

body: The <mark>Clipboard</mark> <mark>API</mark> writes arbitrary data to the <mark>clipboard</mark> from your extension.
Using the <mark>API</mark> requires the permission "<mark>clipboard</mark>Read" or "<mark>clipboard</mark>Write" in your manifest.json file.

<mark>Clipboard</mark> <mark>API</mark>
Permissions <mark>API</mark>
Make content editable
title: Interact with the <mark>clipboard</mark>

body:
The <mark>clipboard</mark>Data property of the <mark>Clipboard</mark>Event interface holds a DataTransfer object, which can be used to:
specify what
data should be put into the <mark>clipboard</mark> from the cut and copy event handlers, typically with a setData(format, data) call;

Copy-related events: copy, cut, paste
The <mark>Clipboard</mark>Event interface it belongs to.

title: <mark>Clipboard</mark>Event: <mark>clipboard</mark>Data property

documents.title: Clipboard: read() method
documents.summary: The read() method of the Clipboard interface requests a copy of the clipboard's contents, fulfilling the returned Promise with the data.

body: Additional security requirements are covered in the Security consideration section of the <mark>API</mark> overview topic.
